title: The struggles of making creative video content - A different view why League is declining possibly

embed.description: Creative content in the League of Legends scene is something I really care about, so I wanted to talk about some of its main issues. body:
A basic TL:DR of the video above (as condensed and summarized as best as I can make it for those who don't want to watch the video that explains stuff very well in 8 minutes instead) is as follows -  

Since all old third party means of recording footage are gone through various issues (Such as intrusive ads, pushed out by Riot's own system, or even just lost support) and Riot's official replay tools on the live client (which took _**7 years**_ for them to even implement in the state they are BTW) are _EXTREMELY_ finicky and difficult to use than said third party tools due to various problems with it, it in turn has made it all the more frustrating for the content creators to well... make creative content.

This thereby causes the content creators to slow down their creative process to deal with such tedious grievances or even hang up their creative caps, leaving the League creative content scene entirely (Need a pretty well known example? Look no further than MagikarpUsedFly's 'Champion Spotlight' videos).

What makes this all the more frustrating, and frankly just insulting at this point, are these two points -

* Fortnite (just go with this for example sake ignoring it's infamous nature here) taking **less than a year** to implement their own replay system, that works perfectly fine and having much more options/tools (like a very good camera system with tools such as Field of View, angles and much more) than Riot's VERY frustrating to use replay system.
* Riot has their own sandbox and camera tools to make their own official high quality trailers for champions and skins, yet won't release these tools to the public. Showing they have these much well designed means with many more tools than the live client replay system has, that content creators desperately could use and would solve the issue at hand, yet deny access of these much more functioning usable tools to everyone. 

___

All in all due to these reasons, one of League's more viewed and enjoyed ways of bringing in more new players and keeping old players around, not to mention being free very well made advertisement for Riot, is declining and slowly fading into obscurity. 

Pretty big eye opener on a thing not many people know the struggles about if you ask me. So that's why I made this thread in hopes to spread the word about it and help League's video creative content creators.
